nano.debugger
Class Debg

java.lang.Object
  nano.debugger.Debg

public class Debg
extends java.lang.Object

A static Debugger to generally decide between System output, or log file, or both, or none.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

debugMode

Constructor Detail

Debg

public Debg()
Method Detail

setDebugMode

public static void setDebugMode(java.lang.String logFileName,
                                int dbgMode)
This allows the different running instances of the remexp package to choose their debug mode.

Parameters:
logFileName - The string that goes between the date and the .log extension. Null if no logfile is used.
dbgMode - The desired debug mode: DEBUGMODE_NODEBUG: no debug messages are displayed or stored. DEBUGMODE_STDOUT: debug messages are printed to the standard output. DEBUGMODE_LOGFILE: debug messages are stored in the logfile. DEBUGMODE_NODEBUG: debug messages are printed to the standard output and stored in the logfile.

print

public static void print(java.lang.String msg)
Processes a normal debug message.

Parameters:
msg - the message to be processed

err

public static void err(java.lang.String msg)
Processes an error debug message.

Parameters:
msg - The error message to be processed.

addThread

public static void addThread(ThreadHandler th)
This class also allows thread tracking. Every started @see ThreadHandler thread will be stored and kept track of until it dies. This method adds a thread to the list of observed threads.

Parameters:
th - The new thread to be tracked

removeThread

public static void removeThread(ThreadHandler th)
Removes a thread from the list of observed threads during its death.

Parameters:
th - the dying thread

print

public static void print(java.lang.String msg,
                         byte[] b)
This method is used to print a message together with a rough overview of the stream data that is being passed to the method if debugging is turned on.

Parameters:
msg - The message that is also printed.
b - The byte array that is used to create a rough overview over the stream.

explainParserError

public static void explainParserError(java.lang.String cmd,
                                      java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,CommandExecutor> cmds)
If a parse error happened for the tokens that are being sent through the event sockets, this method allows to trace why the command wasn't recognized by the parser.

Parameters:
cmd - the command that was sent and has been tried to parse
cmds - the commands that were valid in the appropriate parser

getSource

public static java.lang.String getSource()
This function invokes an exception object and finds the caller of this method.

Returns:
The caller object and the line on which the command has been invoked.

closeLog

public static void closeLog()
This method allows a clean end of the log file.
